item.title: Abstract Data Types
item.description: Abstract Data types are defined by their operations, not their implementation. The Stack ADT The Stack ADT supports the following operations:

item.title: BST Operations
item.description: Search If searchKey = T.key, return. If searchKey < T.key, search T.left; If searchKey > T.key, search T.right; Runtime to complete search on a bushy BST in the worst case is $O(log(n))$.

item.title: BST Performance
item.description: Height and average depth are important properties of BSTs: The depth of a node is how far it is from the root The height of a tree is the depth of its deepest leaf The average depth of a tree is the average depth of a tree’s nodes.

item.title: BST Tree Height
item.description: Height varies dramatically between “bushy” and “spindly” trees. Bushy trees have a height of roughly $log(n)$. Spindly trees have a height of $n$.

item.title: Trees
item.description: A tree consists of A set of nodes A set of edges that connect those nodes Constraint: There is exactly one path between any two nodes.
